components.description:
A yellow face winking with puckered lips blowing a kiss, depicted as a small, red heart. May represent a kiss goodbye or good night and convey feelings of love and affection more generally. 

Many platforms feature the same eyes as on their üòâ Winking Face.

Microsoft’s design previously featured a feminine smiley with long eyelashes and red lipstick, which could leave a kiss mark.
components.title: Face Throwing a Kiss

description:
A yellow face winking with puckered lips blowing a kiss, depicted as a small, red heart. May represent a kiss goodbye or good night and convey feelings of love and affection more generally. 

Many platforms feature the same eyes as on their üòâ Winking Face.

Microsoft’s design previously featured a feminine smiley with long eyelashes and red lipstick, which could leave a kiss mark.
title: Face Throwing a Kiss

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

bn:00100772a: Attractive especially by means of smallness or prettiness or quaintness

bn:00096494a: Inspiring love or affection, in a childlike way.
Lovable especially in a childlike or naive way

bn:00110488a: Marked by or tending to arouse sexual desire or interest

bn:00102103a: Refined and tasteful in appearance or behavior or style

bn:00106204a: Feeling or showing love and affection

bn:00096597a: Loving; manifesting love or affection; affectionate; friendly.
Having affection or warm regard; loving.
Having affection or warm regard; loving; fond.
Having or displaying warmth or affection

bn:00090504v: To have a strong affection for (someone or something).
Have a great affection or liking for
To have an intense feeling of affection and care towards another person.

bn:13611060v: To feel an affection, emotion or love for.

bn:00083805v: Squeeze (someone) tightly in your arms, usually with fondness
To clasp in the arms with affection; to take in the arms; to hug.
To squeeze someone in one's arms.

bn:00084312v: Touch with the lips or press the lips (against someone's mouth or other body part) as an expression of love, greeting, etc.
To touch with the lips to express love or affection.
Of two or more people, to touch each other's lips together, usually to express love or affection or passion.

bn:00052121n: Love is a variety of different feelings, states, and attitudes that ranges from interpersonal affection to pleasure.
An intense feeling of affection and care towards another person.
A strong positive emotion of regard and affection
In the Italian or Latin languages
The form of romantic affection that is considered pure and wholly positive, not just based on feelings of lust.

Love is a word which refers to a variety of different emotional states, feelings or attitudes which range from those of simple personal pleasures or desires to those characterizing interpersonal affection and many forms of profound kindness, compassion, and benevolent concern for the good of others.

bn:00032600n: Part of the body at the front of the head
The face is a central organ of sense and is also very central in the expression of emotion among humans and among numerous other species.
Faces are the central sense organ complexes, for those animals that have one, normally on the ventral surface of the head.
The front of the human head from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear
The front part of the head, featuring the eyes, nose, and mouth and the surrounding area.

bn:00009819n: A beloved person; a term of endearment.
A beloved person; used as terms of endearment

bn:00009419n: A term for a male partner
Regular male companion in a romantic or sexual relationship
A male partner in a romantic relationship.
A boyfriend is a regular male companion in a romantic and/or sexual relationship.
Male partner in a romantic relationship.
A man who is the lover of a girl or young woman

bn:00065006n: The immaterial part of a person; the actuating cause of an individual life

bn:00014726n: A short-lived and unrequited love or infatuation; the object of this infatuation.
A strong feeling of love, often for just a short time, usually by an adolescent.
Puppy love is an informal term for feelings of love, romance, or infatuation, often felt by young people during their childhood and adolescence.
Feelings of love, romance, or infatuation felt by young people

bn:00046516n: A person, especially as one among many.
An individual is a person or a specific object.
A single physical human being as a legal subject, as opposed to a legal person such as a corporation.
A human; someone susceptible to death.

A person is a being, such as a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood, which in turn is defined differently by different authors in different disciplines, and by different cultures in different times and places.
A person that will die eventually.
A being, such as a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood
Abstract term defining a being, e.g. a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood (not for use with "instance of" [P31], instead use "human" [Q5])
An individual; usually a human being.

bn:00001744n: ?, representing love, the organ, or a card suit
A feeling of love or strong attachment.
Affection is a "disposition or rare state of mind or body" that is often associated with a feeling or type of love.

The heart symbol or "heart shape" is an ideograph used to express the idea of the "heart" in its metaphorical or symbolic sense as the center of emotion, including affection and love, especially romantic love.
Philia, often translated "brotherly love", is one of the four ancient Greek words for love: philia, storge, agape and eros.
A conventional shape or symbol used to represent the heart, love, or emotion: ? or sometimes <3.
Affection, attraction, infatuation, or fondness is a "disposition or rare state of mind or body" that is often associated with a feeling or type of love.
As used by Aristotle in his Nichomachean Ethics
A stylized representation of the muscular organ, used as a symbol for affection, in the shape of two top lobes and a tapering bottom.
Feeling of love or strong attachment.

bn:00033885n: A celebration of lovers that is observed on February 14.
Saint Valentine's Day, commonly shortened to Valentine's Day, is an annual commemoration held on February 14 celebrating love and affection between intimate companions. Day

February 14 Quotes of the day from previous years:; 2004; 2005; 2006; 2007; 2008; 2009; 2010; 2011; 2012; 2013; 2014; 2015; 2016: Rank or add further suggestions. Ranking system: Love does not dominate, it cultivates. 14
A day for the exchange of tokens of affection
Saint Valentine's Day, also known as Valentine's Day or the Feast of Saint Valentine, is a holiday observed on February 14 each year.

bn:00034453n: A young female human; (in contrast to boy), a female child or young adult.
A title of respect for a young woman (usually unmarried) with or without a name used.
A young female person, usually a child or teenager.
A girl is any female human from birth through childhood and adolescence to attainment of adulthood when she becomes a woman.
A girl is a female human from birth through childhood and adolescence to attainment of adulthood when she becomes a woman.

bn:00014182n: A kiss is the touch or pressing of one's lips against another person or an object.
Touch with the lips, usually to express love or affection, or as a greeting
A touch with the lips, usually to express love or affection, or as a greeting.
The act of caressing with the lips (or an instance thereof)
A touch with the lips as a sign of love or affection.
Kissing is the act of two people touching lips.

bn:00345232n: Cuteness is a subjective term describing a type of attractiveness commonly associated with youth and appearance, as well as a scientific concept and analytical model in ethology, first introduced by Konrad Lorenz.

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the face blowing a kiss emoji features a cheerful, rosy-cheeked countenance with its lips puckered and a playful wink. Apple's signature 3D shading and realistic lighting give the face a soft, rounded, and inviting appearance, with subtle highlights on the cheeks and lips. This emoji, as designed by Apple, conveys affection, fondness, and a lighthearted romantic gesture, perfect for sending a sweet or flirtatious message.
